tagRef.name: Creature
tagRef.tooltip: Creature reference for swarm characters ONLY

float32.name: Scariness
float32.tooltip: the inherent scariness of the character

float32.name: Normal Body Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum body vitality of our unit

float32.name: Normal Shield Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum shield vitality of our unit

float32.name: Legendary Body Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum body vitality of our unit (on legendary)

float32.name: Legendary Shield Vitality
float32.tooltip: maximum shield vitality of our unit (on legendary)

float32.name: Body Recharge Fraction
float32.tooltip: fraction of body health that can be regained after damage

float32.name: Soft Ping Threshold (With Shields)
float32.tooltip: damage necessary to trigger a soft ping when shields are up

float32.name: Soft Ping Threshold (No Shields)
float32.tooltip: damage necessary to trigger a soft ping when shields are down

float32.name: Soft Ping Minimum Interrupt Time
float32.tooltip: minimum time before a soft ping can be interrupted

float32.name: Hard Ping Threshold (With Shields)
float32.tooltip: damage necessary to trigger a hard ping when shields are up

float32.name: Hard Ping Threshold (No Shields)
float32.tooltip: damage necessary to trigger a hard ping when shields are down

float32.name: Hard Ping Minimum Interrupt Time
float32.tooltip: minimum time before a hard ping can be interrupted

float32.name: Current Damage Decay Delay
float32.tooltip: current damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage

float32.name: Current Damage Decay Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time it would take for 100% current damage to decay to 0

float32.name: Recent Damage Decay Delay
float32.tooltip: recent damage begins to fall after a time delay has passed since last the damage

float32.name: Recent Damage Decay Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time it would take for 100% recent damage to decay to 0

float32.name: Body Recharge Delay Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge

float32.name: Body Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time for shields to recharge completely

float32.name: Shield Recharge Delay Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge

float32.name: Shield Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time for shields to recharge completely

float32.name: Stun Threshold
float32.tooltip: stun level that triggers the stunned state (currently, the 'stunned' behavior)

float32.name: Extended Shield Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Amount of shield damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'

float32.name: Extended Body Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: Amount of body damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'

float32.name: Suicide Radius
float32.tooltip: when I die and explode, I damage stuff within this distance of me.

float32.name: Maximum Vision Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum range of sight

degree.name: Central Vision Angle
degree.tooltip: horizontal angle within which we see targets out to our maximum range

degree.name: Maximum Vision Angle
degree.tooltip: maximum horizontal angle within which we see targets at range

degree.name: Peripheral Vision Angle
degree.tooltip: maximum horizontal angle within which we can see targets out of the corner of our eye

float32.name: Peripheral Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum range at which we can see targets out of the corner of our eye

float32.name: Hearing Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum range at which sounds can be heard

float32.name: Notice Projectile Chance
float32.tooltip: random chance of noticing a dangerous enemy projectile (e.g. grenade)

float32.name: Notice Vehicle Chance
float32.tooltip: random chance of noticing a dangerous vehicle

float32.name: Combat Perception Time
float32.tooltip: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy when we are already in combat or searching for them

float32.name: Guard Perception Time
float32.tooltip: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy when we have been alerted

float32.name: Non-Combat Perception Time
float32.tooltip: time required to acknowledge a visible enemy when we are not alerted

float32.name: First Acknowledge Surprise Distance
float32.tooltip: If a new prop is acknowledged within the given distance, surprise is registered

degree2.name: Maximum Aiming Deviation
degree2.tooltip: how far we can turn our weapon

degree2.name: Maximum Looking Deviation
degree2.tooltip: how far we can turn our head

degree.name: Noncombat Look Delta Left
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head left away from our aiming vector when not in combat

degree.name: Noncombat Look Delta Right
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head right away from our aiming vector when not in combat

degree.name: Combat Look Delta Left
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head left away from our aiming vector when in combat

degree.name: Combat Look Delta Right
degree.tooltip: how far we can turn our head right away from our aiming vector when in combat

rangef.name: Noncombat Idle Looking
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change look around randomly when not in combat

rangef.name: Noncombat Idle Aiming
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change aiming directions when looking around randomly when not in combat

rangef.name: Combat Idle Looking
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change look around randomly when searching or in combat

rangef.name: Combat Idle Aiming
rangef.tooltip: rate at which we change aiming directions when looking around randomly when searching or in combat

int16.name: Scatter Killed Count
int16.tooltip: After the given number of deaths, the swarm scatters

float32.name: Scatter Radius
float32.tooltip: the distance from the target that the swarm scatters

float32.name: Scatter Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time to remain scattered

float32.name: Perlin Offset Scale
float32.tooltip: amount of randomness added to creature's throttle

rangef.name: Offset Period
rangef.tooltip: how fast the creature changes random offset to throttle

float32.name: Perlin Idle Movement Threshold
float32.tooltip: a random offset lower then given threshold is made 0. (threshold of 1 = no movement)

float32.name: Perlin Combat Movement Threshold
float32.tooltip: a random offset lower then given threshold is made 0. (threshold of 1 = no movement)

rangef.name: Ready Time Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Character will pause for given time before engaging threat

float32.name: Crouch Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger rises above the threshold, the actor crouches

float32.name: Stand Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger drops below this threshold, the actor can stand again.

float32.name: Fight Danger Move Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger goes above given level, this actor switches firing positions

float32.name: Melee Chance
float32.tooltip: chance of initiating a melee within a 1 second period

float32.name: Melee Attack Timeout
float32.tooltip: Give up after given amount of time spent charging

float32.name: Melee Attack Delay Timer
float32.tooltip: don't attempt again before given time since last melee

float32.name: Melee Leap Ballistic
float32.tooltip: min ballistic fraction

float32.name: Melee Delay Timer
float32.tooltip: time between melee leaps

tagRef.name: Berserk Weapon
tagRef.tooltip: when I berserk, I pull out a ...

plugin.comment: Danger values can be found in the ai-globals section of the globals tag.

float32.name: Evasion Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: Consider evading when immediate danger surpasses threshold

float32.name: Evasion Delay Timer
float32.tooltip: Wait at least this delay between evasions

float32.name: Evasion Chance
float32.tooltip: If danger is above threshold, the chance that we will evade. Expressed as chance of evading within a 1 second time period

float32.name: Evasion Proximity Threshold
float32.tooltip: If target is within given proximity, possibly evade

float32.name: Dive Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: Chance of retreating (fleeing) after danger avoidance dive

tagblock.name: Cover Properties

rangef.name: Hide Behind Cover Time
rangef.tooltip: how long we stay behind cover after seeking cover

float32.name: Cover Vitality Threshold
float32.tooltip: When vitality drops below this level, possibly trigger a cover

float32.name: Cover Shield Fraction
float32.tooltip: trigger cover when shield drops below this fraction (low shield cover impulse must be enabled)

float32.name: Cover Check Delay
float32.tooltip: amount of time I will wait before trying again after covering

float32.name: Emerge From Cover When Shield Fraction Reaches Threshold
float32.tooltip: Emerge from cover when shield fraction reaches threshold

float32.name: Cover Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: Danger must be this high to cover. At a danger level of 'danger threshold', the chance of seeking cover is the cover chance lower bound (below)

float32.name: Danger Upper Threshold
float32.tooltip: At or above danger level of upper threshold, the chance of seeking cover is the cover chance upper bound (below)

tagblock.comment: The bounds on the chance of seeking cover. The lower bound is valid when the danger is at 'danger threshold' The upper bound is valid when the danger is at or above 'danger upper threshold'. It is interpolated linearly everywhere in between. All chances are expressed as 'chance of triggering cover in a 1 second period'.

rangef.name: Cover Chance
rangef.tooltip: Bounds on the chances of seeking cover.

float32.name: Proximity Self-Preserve
float32.tooltip: When the proximity_self_preservation impulse is enabled, triggers self-preservation when target within this distance

float32.name: Disallow Cover Distance
float32.tooltip: Disallow covering from visible target under the given distance away

float32.name: Proximity Melee Distance
float32.tooltip: When self preserving from a target less than given distance, causes melee attack (assuming proximity_melee_impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Unreachable Enemy Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When danger from an unreachable enemy surpasses threshold, actor cover (assuming unreachable_enemy_cover impulse is enabled)

float32.name: Scary Target Threshold
float32.tooltip: When target is aware of me and surpasses the given scariness, self-preserve (scary_target_cover_impulse)

float32.name: Shield Threshold
float32.tooltip: When shield vitality drops below given amount, retreat is triggered by low_shield_retreat_impulse

float32.name: Scary Target Threshold
float32.tooltip: When confronting an enemy of over the given scariness, retreat is triggered by scary_target_retreat_impulse

float32.name: Danger Threshold
float32.tooltip: When perceived danger rises above the given threshold, retreat is triggered by danger_retreat_impulse

float32.name: Proximity Threshold
float32.tooltip: When enemy closer than given threshold, retreat is triggered by proximity_retreat_impulse

rangef.name: Forced Cower Time Bounds
rangef.tooltip: actor cowers for at least the given amount of time

rangef.name: Cower Timeout Bounds
rangef.tooltip: actor times out of cower after the given amount of time

float32.name: Proximity Ambush Threshold
float32.tooltip: If target reaches is within the given proximity, an ambush is triggered by the proximity ambush impulse

float32.name: Awareness Ambush Threshold
float32.tooltip: If target is less than threshold (0-1) aware of me, an ambush is triggered by the vulnerable enemy ambush impulse

float32.name: Leader Dead Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: If leader-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when our leader dies within 4 world units of us

float32.name: Peer Dead Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when one of our peers (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

float32.name: Second Peer Dead Retreat Chance
float32.tooltip: If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when a second peer (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

degree.name: Zig-Zag Angle
degree.tooltip: The angle from the intended destination direction that a zig-zag will cause

float32.name: Zig-Zag Period
float32.tooltip: How long it takes to zig left and then zag right.

float32.name: Retreat Grenade Chance
float32.tooltip: The likelihood of throwing down a grenade to cover our retreat

tagRef.name: Backup Weapon
tagRef.tooltip: If I want to flee and I don't have flee animations with my current weapon, throw it away and try a ...

rangef.name: Uncover Distance Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Distance of uncover point from target. Hard lower limit, soft upper limit.

rangef.name: Minimum Presearch Time
rangef.tooltip: If the min presearch time expires and the target is (actually) outside the min-certainty radius, presearch turns off

rangef.name: Maximum Presearch Time
rangef.tooltip: Presearch turns off after the given time

rangef.name: Minimum Suppressing Time
rangef.tooltip: if the min suppressing time expires and the target is outside the min-certainty radius, suppressing fire turns off

rangef.name: Idle Pose Delay Time
rangef.tooltip: time range for delays between idle poses

float32.name: Look Comment Time
float32.tooltip: How long does the player look at an AI before the AI responds?

float32.name: Look Long Comment Time
float32.tooltip: How long does the player look at the AI before he responds with his 'long look' comment?

float32.name: Maximum Distance
float32.tooltip: maximum distance from entry point that we will consider boarding

float32.name: Abort Distance
float32.tooltip: give up trying to get in boarding seat if entry point is further away than this

float32.name: Maximum Speed
float32.tooltip: maximum speed at which we will consider boarding

float32.name: Flurry Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: when more than x damage is caused a juggernaut flurry is triggered

float32.name: Flurry Time
float32.tooltip: flurry lasts this long

tagblock.name: Weapons Properties

float32.name: Maximum Firing Range
float32.tooltip: we can only fire our weapon at targets within this distance

float32.name: Minimum Firing Range
float32.tooltip: weapon will not be fired at target closer than given distance

float32.name: Bombardment Range
float32.tooltip: we offset our burst targets randomly by this range when firing at non-visible enemies (zero = never)

float32.name: Maximum Special Target Distance
float32.tooltip: Specific target regions on a vehicle or unit will be fired upon only under the given distance

float32.name: Super-Ballistic Range
float32.tooltip: we try to aim our shots super-ballistically if target is outside this range (zero = never)

rangef.name: Ballistic Firing Bounds
rangef.tooltip: At the min range, the min ballistic fraction is used, at the max, the max ballistic fraction is used

rangef.name: Ballistic Fraction Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Controls speed and degree of arc. 0 = high, slow, 1 = low, fast

vector3.name: Custom Stand Gun Offset
vector3.tooltip: custom standing gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

vector3.name: Custom Crouch Gun Offset
vector3.tooltip: custom crouching gun offset for overriding the default in the base actor

enum16.name: Special-Fire Mode
enum16.tooltip: the type of special weapon fire that we can use

enum16.name: Special-Fire Situation
enum16.tooltip: when we will decide to use our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: Special-Fire Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to use our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: Special-Fire Delay
float32.tooltip: how long we must wait between uses of our special weapon fire mode

float32.name: Special Damage Modifier
float32.tooltip: damage modifier for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal damage modifier. zero = no change)

degree.name: Special Projectile Error
degree.tooltip: projectile error angle for special weapon fire (applied in addition to the normal error)

rangef.name: Drop Weapon Loaded
rangef.tooltip: amount of ammo loaded into the weapon that we drop (in fractions of a clip, e.g. 0.3 to 0.5)

range16.name: Drop Weapon Ammo
range16.tooltip: total number of rounds in the weapon that we drop (ignored for energy weapons)

tagblock.comment: Parameters control how accuracy changes over the duration of a series of bursts Accuracy is an analog value between 0 and 1. At zero, the parameters of the first firing-pattern block is used. At 1, the parameters in the second block is used. In between, all the values are linearly interpolated

rangef.name: Normal Accuracy Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at normal difficulty

float32.name: Normal Accuracy Time
float32.tooltip: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

rangef.name: Heroic Accuracy Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at heroic difficulty

float32.name: Heroic Accuracy Time
float32.tooltip: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

rangef.name: Legendary Accuracy Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Indicates starting and ending accuracies at legendary difficulty

float32.name: Legendary Accuracy Time
float32.tooltip: The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

tagblock.name: Firing Patterns

float32.name: Rate Of Fire
float32.tooltip: how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)

float32.name: Target Tracking
float32.tooltip: how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position

float32.name: Target Leading
float32.tooltip: how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

tagblock.comment:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

float32.name: Burst Origin Radius
float32.tooltip: how far away from the target the starting point is

degree.name: Burst Origin Angle
degree.tooltip: the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

rangef.name: Burst Return Length
rangef.tooltip: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative)

degree.name: Burst Return Angle
degree.tooltip: the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

rangef.name: Burst Duration
rangef.tooltip: how long each burst we fire is

rangef.name: Burst Separation
rangef.tooltip: how long we wait between bursts

float32.name: Weapon Damage Modifier
float32.tooltip: what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

degree.name: Projectile Error
degree.tooltip: error added to every projectile we fire

degree.name: Burst Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)

degree.name: Maximum Error Angle
degree.tooltip: cap on the maximum angle by which we will miss target (restriction on burst origin radius)

tagblock.name: Firing Patterns

float32.name: Rate Of Fire
float32.tooltip: how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)

float32.name: Target Tracking
float32.tooltip: how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position

float32.name: Target Leading
float32.tooltip: how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

tagblock.comment:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

float32.name: Burst Origin Radius
float32.tooltip: how far away from the target the starting point is

degree.name: Burst Origin Angle
degree.tooltip: the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

rangef.name: Burst Return Length
rangef.tooltip: how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative)

degree.name: Burst Return Angle
degree.tooltip: the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

rangef.name: Burst Duration
rangef.tooltip: how long each burst we fire is

rangef.name: Burst Separation
rangef.tooltip: how long we wait between bursts

float32.name: Weapon Damage Modifier
float32.tooltip: what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

degree.name: Projectile Error
degree.tooltip: error added to every projectile we fire

degree.name: Burst Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)

degree.name: Maximum Error Angle
degree.tooltip: cap on the maximum angle by which we will miss target (restriction on burst origin radius)

enum16.name: Grenade Type
enum16.tooltip: type of grenades that we throw

int16.name: Minimum Enemy Count
int16.tooltip: how many enemies must be within the radius of the grenade before we will consider throwing there

float32.name: Enemy Radius
float32.tooltip: we consider enemies within this radius when determining where to throw

float32.name: Grenade Ideal Velocity
float32.tooltip: how fast we LIKE to throw our grenades

float32.name: Grenade Velocity
float32.tooltip: the fastest we can possibly throw our grenades

rangef.name: Grenade Ranges
rangef.tooltip: ranges within which we will consider throwing a grenade

float32.name: Collateral Damage Radius
float32.tooltip: we won't throw if there are friendlies around our target within this range

float32.name: Grenade Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to throw a grenade in one second

float32.name: Grenade Throw Delay
float32.tooltip: How long we have to wait after throwing a grenade before we can throw another one

float32.name: Grenade Uncover Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to throw a grenade to flush out a target in one second

float32.name: Anti-Vehicle Grenade Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are to throw a grenade against a vehicle

range16.name: Grenade Count
range16.tooltip: number of grenades that we start with

float32.name: Don't Drop Grenades Chance
float32.tooltip: how likely we are not to drop any grenades when we die, even if we still have some

float32.name: AI Pathfinding Radius
float32.tooltip: (Ground vehicles)

float32.name: AI Destination Radius
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) Distance within which goal is considered reached

float32.name: AI Deceleration Distance
float32.tooltip: world units. (All vehicles) Distance from goal at which AI starts to decelerate

float32.name: AI Turning Radius
float32.tooltip: (Warthog, Pelican, Ghost) Idealized average turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

float32.name: AI Inner Turning Radius (< Radius)
float32.tooltip: (Warthog-type) Idealized minimum turning radius (should reflect actual vehicle physics)

float32.name: AI Ideal Turning Radius (> Radius)
float32.tooltip: (Warthogs, ghosts) Ideal turning radius for rounding turns (barring obstacles, etc.)

float32.name: AI Maximum Steering Angle
float32.tooltip: (Warthog, ghosts, wraiths) Maximum steering angle from forward (ultimately controls turning speed)

float32.name: AI Maximum Steering Delta
float32.tooltip: (pelicans, dropships, ghosts, wraiths) Maximum delta in steering angle from one tick to the next (ultimately controls turn acceleration)

float32.name: AI Oversteering Scale
float32.tooltip: (Warthog, ghosts, wraiths)

ranged.name: AI Oversteering Bounds
ranged.tooltip: (Banshee) Angle to goal at which AI will oversteer

float32.name: AI Sideslip Distance
float32.tooltip: (Ghosts, Dropships) Distance within which AI will strafe to target (as opposed to turning)

float32.name: AI Avoidance Distance
float32.tooltip: (Banshee-style) Look-ahead distance for obstacle avoidance

float32.name: AI Minimum Urgency
float32.tooltip: (Banshees) The minimum urgency with which a turn can be made (urgency = percent of maximum steering delta)

float32.name: AI Throttle Maximum
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles)

float32.name: AI Goal Minimum Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: (Warthogs, Dropships, ghosts) scale on throttle when within 'ai deceleration distance' of goal (0...1)

float32.name: AI Turn Minimum Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: (Warthogs, ghosts) Scale on throttle due to nearness to a turn (0...1)

float32.name: AI Direction Minimum Throttle Scale
float32.tooltip: (Warthogs, ghosts) Scale on throttle due to facing away from intended direction (0...1)

float32.name: AI Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: (warthogs, ghosts) The maximum allowable change in throttle between ticks

float32.name: AI Throttle Blend
float32.tooltip: (dropships, sentinels) The degree of throttle blending between one tick and the next (0 = no blending)

float32.name: Theoretical Maximum Speed
float32.tooltip: (dropships, warthogs, ghosts) About how fast I can go.

float32.name: Error Scale
float32.tooltip: (dropships, warthogs) scale on the difference between desired and actual speed, applied to throttle

float32.name: AI Charge Tight Angle Distance
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) The distance at which the tight angle criterion is used for deciding to vehicle charge

float32.name: AI Charge Tight Angle
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) Angle cosine within which the target is closer than tight angle distance in order to charge

float32.name: AI Charge Repeat Timeout
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) Time delay between vehicle charges

float32.name: AI Charge Look-Ahead Time
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) In deciding when to abort vehicle charge, look ahead these many seconds to predict time of contact

float32.name: AI Charge Consider Distance
float32.tooltip: Consider charging the target when it is within this range (0 = infinite distance)

float32.name: AI Charge Abort Distance
float32.tooltip: Abort the charge when the target get more than this far away (0 = never abort)

float32.name: Vehicle Ram Timeout
float32.tooltip: The ram behavior stops after a maximum of the given number of seconds

float32.name: Ram Paralysis Time
float32.tooltip: The ram behavior freezes the vehicle for a given number of seconds after performing the ram

float32.name: AI Cover Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) Trigger a cover when recent damage is above given threshold (damage_vehicle_cover impulse)

float32.name: AI Cover Minimum Distance
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) When executing vehicle-cover, minimum distance from the target to flee to

float32.name: AI Cover Time
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) How long to stay away from the target

float32.name: AI Cover Minimum Boost Distance
float32.tooltip: (All vehicles) Boosting allowed when distance to cover destination is greater then this

float32.name: Turtling Recent Damage Threshold
float32.tooltip: If vehicle turtling behavior is enabled, turtling is initiated if 'recent damage' surpasses the given threshold

float32.name: Turtling Minimum Time
float32.tooltip: If the vehicle turtling behavior is enabled, turtling occurs for at least the given time

float32.name: Turtling Timeout
float32.tooltip: The turtled state times out after the given number of seconds
